summary: The "Don't Sell My DNA Act" amends Title 11 of the United States Code (Bankruptcy) to protect genetic information. It defines genetic information according to the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act of 2008. The bill prohibits the use, sale, or lease of genetic information in bankruptcy proceedings without explicit, written consent from affected individuals. It also mandates the deletion of genetic information from the estate if not subject to sale or lease, using court-approved methods.
